meanings.definition: A person who is able to hear.
meanings.sent1: The audiles in the room enjoyed the music.
meanings.sent2: The audiles could hear the birds chirping outside.
meanings.sent3: The audiles at the concert clapped enthusiastically.
meanings.sent4: Her audiles perked up when she heard her favorite song.
meanings.sent5: The audiles of the dog alerted it to the approaching footsteps.

meanings.definition: Relating to the sense of hearing.
meanings.sent1: She had audiles memories of the sound of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The audiles experience of the movie was enhanced by the surround sound.
meanings.sent3: The audiles decorations at the party included musical notes.
meanings.sent4: His audiles mind could distinguish different instruments in the orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The audiles atmosphere of the forest was filled with bird songs.

meanings.sent1: The audiles voice of the singer filled the auditorium.
meanings.sent2: The audiles alarm could be heard throughout the building.
meanings.sent3: The audiles laughter of the children echoed in the park.
meanings.sent4: The audiles footsteps approached slowly in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The audiles thunderstorm rumbled in the distance.
